title: Over 138,000 tourist arrivals recorded in June
byline: A total of 138,241 tourists arrived in the country in June 2025, data from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) shows.

title: MOD reviews progress of Defence Headquarters Complex construction
byline: A high-level progress review meeting on the Defence Headquarters Complex project has been held at the Ministry of Defence, Sri Jayewardenepura Kotte.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts today (02), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Israel has agreed to conditions for 60-day Gaza ceasefire, Trump says
byline: Israel has agreed to the “necessary conditions” to finalise a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, US President Donald Trump has said.

title: Man arrested with counterfeit USD notes in Minuwangoda
byline: An individual has been arrested for the possession of six counterfeit US dollar notes by the Minuwangoda Police.

title: Haj delegation hails Saudi Arabia’s outstanding arrangements for 3,500 Sri Lankans
byline: Ambassador of Sri Lanka to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Omar Lebbe Ameer Ajwad on behalf of the government of Sri Lanka has extended his sincere appreciation to King Salman bin Abdul Azeez for his leadership to make Haj - 2025 arrangements as smooth, peaceful and a resounding success.

title: PUCSL seeks public opinion on challenges faced by renewable energy developers
byline: A public consultation will be held today (02) to identify the challenges faced by renewable energy developers in Sri Lanka, the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced.

title: Jayne Howell assumes duties as Deputy Chief of US Mission in Sri Lanka
byline: Jayne Howell, a seasoned career diplomat and member of the US Senior Foreign Service, has assumed duties as the Deputy Chief of Mission at the U.S. Embassy in Colombo.

title: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan to arrive in Sri Lanka on 2 August
byline: Bollywood star Shah Rukh Khan is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on 2 August.

title: Trump says he’ll ‘look’ at deporting Musk as feud reignites
byline: President Donald Trump told reporters Tuesday his administration will “have to take a look” at deporting Elon Musk after the billionaire reignited the feud with the president over his spending bill.

title: Wild storm in Sydney disrupts flights, thousands without power
byline: A wild weather system pummelled Sydney for a second day on Wednesday (Jul 2), with the storm forcing the cancellation of dozens of flights, bringing down trees and taking out power to thousands of homes in Australia’s southeast.

title: Indictments served on Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his grandmother
byline: Indictments have been served before the Colombo High Court on Yoshitha Rajapaksa and his grandmother Daisy Forest.

title: Alibaba Cloud announces new data centres in Malaysia, the Philippines
byline: Alibaba Cloud, the cloud computing arm of Chinese tech giant Alibaba Group, announced the opening of its third data center in Malaysia on Tuesday and disclosed plans to launch a second data center in the Philippines in October, according to a statement released on Wednesday.

title: Australia’s Qantas says 6 million customer accounts accessed in cyber hack
byline: A cyber hacker broke into a database containing the personal information of millions of customers, Qantas  said, in Australia’s biggest breach in years and a setback for an airline rebuilding trust after a reputational crisis.

title: Dalai Lama says his Trust will lead search for his successor
byline: The Dalai Lama said on Wednesday that a non-profit that he has founded will have the sole authority to recognise his future reincarnation, countering China’s insistence that it will choose the successor of the Tibetan spiritual leader.

title: Trump Tariff: Govt hopeful of some relief before 9 July
byline: The government is hopeful of receiving some form of concession to the ‘reciprocal tariffs’ announced by US President Donald Trump before July 9, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said.

title: “Starlink now available in Sri Lanka,” Elon Musk confirms
byline: Starlink’s high-speed, low-latency satellite internet service is now officially available in Sri Lanka, its owner and billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk confirmed in a tweet on Wednesday.

title: Paddy Marketing Board to commence paddy purchasing, fixed prices announced
byline: The Paddy Marketing Board is scheduled to begin purchasing paddy from tomorrow (03) with the commencement of the harvest for the ‘Yala’ season.

title: Injured elephant spotted near Kandalama in critical condition
byline: A wild elephant with a gunshot wound to one of his back legs has been spotted near the Kandalama Reservoir, according to the Ada Derana reporter.

title: Cabinet nod to appoint Presidential Investigation Committee to probe irregularities at Sri Lankan Airlines
byline: The Cabinet has granted approval to the proposal to establish a Special Presidential Investigation Committee to investigate frauds, corruption and irregularities occurred in the past within SriLankan Airlines Limited and Airport and Aviation (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited.

title: Govt to present 2026 Appropriation Bill in October, Budget speech in November
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to the proposal to present the appropriation bill for the year 2026 to Parliament in October 2025.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink launches satellite internet in Sri Lanka
byline: Starlink’s high-speed, low-latency satellite internet service is now officially available in Sri Lanka, its owner and billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk confirmed in a tweet on Wednesday.

title: Malaysia considers visa-free entry for Sri Lankan citizens – report
byline: Malaysia is moving forward with a proposal to offer visa-free entry to citizens of Sri Lanka, marking a significant step in deepening tourism cooperation and regional connectivity, according to foreign media reports.

title: Trump Tariff: Govt hopeful of some relief before 9 July deadline
byline: The government is hopeful of receiving some form of concession to the ‘reciprocal tariffs’ announced by US President Donald Trump before July 9, Cabinet Spokesman Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has said.

title: New Norwood PS Chairman assumes duties amid tight security
byline: Johannes Francis Allen, who was elected to the Norwood Pradeshiya Sabha from the National People’s Power (NPP), and Sivakumar Nadarajah, who was elected to the Pradeshiya Sabha from the Tamil Progressive Alliance (TPA), officially assumed duties as the Chairman and Deputy Chairman respectively amidst tight police security.

title: Sarvajana Balaya suspends party membership of Padiyathalawa PS member
byline: The ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance has decided to suspend the party membership of Padiyathalawa Pradeshiya Sabha member Chathun Irangika Withanage for acting against party directives during the establishment of power in the said local council.

title: Foreign university scholarships for A/L top achievers
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to implement the programme to provide scholarships for students who obtained higher grades at the G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination to study their first degree at foreign universities.

title: ‘Victory 45-47’: Trump launches perfume with gold statue of him on bottle
byline: President Donald Trump announced on Monday a limited edition, self-branded fragrance with a gold statue of him on the bottle, urging his supporters to “get one for your loved ones.”

title: Galle Literary Festival 2026 returns with 13th edition
byline: After the resounding success of its 2025 edition, the Galle Literary Festival is set to return for its 13th year from 22–25 January 2026, with the exclusive Opening night scheduled for 21 January.

title: Cabinet nod to appoint Presidential Investigation Committee to probe irregularities at SriLankan Airlines
byline: The Cabinet has granted approval to the proposal to establish a Special Presidential Investigation Committee to investigate frauds, corruption and irregularities occurred in the past within SriLankan Airlines Limited and Airport and Aviation (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited.

title: France shuts schools, Italy limits outdoor work as heatwave grips Europe
byline: Italy banned outdoor work in some regions during the warmest hours, France shut schools and part of the Eiffel Tower and Spain confirmed its hottest June on record as a severe heat wave gripped Europe, triggering widespread health alerts.

title: China says it must approve Dalai Lama’s succession
byline: The Dalai Lama’s succession through his reincarnation must be approved by China’s central government, its foreign ministry said on Wednesday.

title: National Mosquito Control Week: Over 48,000 premises inspected islandwide
byline: The Ministry of Health has announced that inspections will continue across the country today (July 2), marking the third day of National Mosquito Control Week.

title: ‘Aswesuma’ Phase 2: List of eligible families released
byline: The list of eligible families selected for the second phase of the ‘Aswesuma’ welfare benefit allowance has been officially released.

title: Ex-President Ranil thanks Elon Musk for Starlink
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has expressed his gratitude to SpaceX founder and CEO, Elon Musk, for enabling access to Starlink satellite internet services for all Sri Lankans.

title: Petition against MP Archchuna fixed for hearing
byline: The Court of Appeal today (02) granted leave to proceed with the hearing of the petition filed seeking to nullify the parliamentary membership of Jaffna District Independent MP Ramanathan Archchuna.

title: Kahawatta OIC transferred to facilitate shooting investigation
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Kahawatta Police Station has been transferred to the Jaffna Police Division to facilitate investigations into the shooting to death of a youth that occurred in Kahawatta on 30 June.

title: Trump threatens Japan with tariff up to 35% as deadline looms
byline: US President Donald Trump has threatened to impose a “30% or 35%” tariff on Japan if a deal between the two countries is not reached before a deadline next week.

title: Trains delayed on coastal line
byline: Train services on the coastal line has been delayed due to a train breaking down between Kollupitiya and Slave Island railway stations, the Department of Railways announced.

title: Netherlands and Sri Lanka agree to conduct joint research on colonial-era artefacts
byline: A discussion was held today (2) at the Presidential Secretariat between Dr. Nandika Sanath Kumanayake, Secretary to the President and Bonnie Horbach, the Ambassador of the Netherlands to Sri Lanka.
